main event: Radar detected an unidentified target on a collision course with NAS, accompanied by a visual observation of a pale blue light.
interesting points: The radar tracked the target from 20 miles to within 2 miles of NAS at an estimated speed of 2800 knots., The visual observation was made with binoculars but contact was lost when the observer turned away., Other personnel called for visual checks but only one observer reported seeing the pale blue light., Comments note that anomalous propagation can cause false radar targets., The speed observed is higher than typical for large aircraft.
witness description: Air Force personnel acting as approach controllers.
